intro: Rubus furvus var. ferox, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a thorny shrub native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It produces aggregate fruits composed of small, juicy drupelets that are typically dark purple to black in color. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges and is covered in fine, silvery hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed areas. The plant is valued for its edible fruits and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
